definitions: process of arranging text, images, and other elements on a page or screen
examples: The document needs proper formatting before submission
She spent hours on formatting the research paper

definitions: official list of approved medications covered by a health insurance plan or healthcare system
examples: The doctor checked the formulary to see which drugs were covered
The insurance company updated their formulary to include new medications

definitions: process of creating a mixture with specific ingredients and proportions
careful expression or development of a plan, theory, or policy
examples: The pharmaceutical company worked on a new formulation for the medicine
Scientists tested different formulations to achieve the desired results
The committee presented their formulation of the new policy
Her formulation of the theory was clear and precise

definitions: consensual sexual intercourse between two people not married to each other
examples: Many religions consider fornication to be morally wrong
The preacher spoke against fornication in his sermon

definitions: permanent military stronghold with walls and defensive structures
examples: The soldiers defended the fort against enemy attacks
We visited an old fort that was built during colonial times

definitions: something at which a person excels or shows particular strength
musical passage played loudly or with strong emphasis
examples: Mathematics has always been her forte
Public speaking is definitely not my forte
The orchestra played the forte section with tremendous power
The composer marked this passage as forte in the score

definitions: number or position that comes after thirty-ninth in a sequence
examples: She celebrated her fortieth birthday with family and friends
The fortieth anniversary of the company was marked with celebrations

definitions: defensive wall or other reinforcement built to strengthen a place against attack
action of making something stronger physically, emotionally, or nutritionally
examples: The ancient city was surrounded by impressive fortifications
Enemy troops could not breach the castle's fortifications
The fortification of breakfast cereals with vitamins helps prevent deficiencies
Mental fortification through meditation helped her cope with stress

definitions: courage and strength shown when facing pain, danger, or difficult situations
examples: She showed remarkable fortitude during her long illness
It takes fortitude to stand up for what you believe in

definitions: period of fourteen days or two weeks
examples: They're going on vacation for a fortnight
The project will be completed within a fortnight

definitions: cardinal number equal to four times ten
examples: The temperature reached forty degrees Celsius yesterday
She invited forty guests to her wedding reception

definitions: action of sending something received to another destination or person
examples: Mail forwarding ensures you receive letters at your new address
The company handles forwarding of packages to international destinations

definitions: temporary care of children by people other than their parents
action of encouraging or promoting the development of something
examples: The couple has been fostering children for over ten years
The agency specializes in fostering placements for teenagers
The school focuses on fostering creativity in young students
Community programs are fostering better relationships between neighbors

definitions: illegal action or play in sports that breaks established rules
examples: The referee called a foul on the defensive player
He committed his fifth foul and had to leave the game

definitions: act of establishing or creating an institution, organization, or settlement
examples: The founding of the university took place in 1850
We celebrate the founding of our nation every July

definitions: infant or young child found abandoned and without known parents
examples: The orphanage cared for many foundlings during the war
The story tells of a foundling who became a great leader

definitions: industrial facility where metal is melted and cast into specific shapes
examples: The foundry produces iron castings for automotive parts
Workers at the foundry wear protective gear against molten metal

definitions: structure that shoots water into the air for decorative purposes
original source or origin of something desirable or valuable
examples: Children played near the fountain in the town square
The fountain's water jets created a beautiful display
The library was a fountain of knowledge for researchers
She was considered a fountain of wisdom in the community

definitions: original source from which something springs or develops
examples: Ancient Greece is often called the fountainhead of democracy
The university became a fountainhead of progressive ideas

definitions: cardinal number between three and five
examples: The table has four legs for stability
We need four volunteers for this project

definitions: group or set of four people or things
examples: The golf foursome teed off early in the morning
Our dinner foursome meets every Friday night

definitions: cardinal number equal to ten plus four
examples: She will turn fourteen next month
The recipe calls for fourteen ounces of flour

definitions: number or position that comes after thirteenth in a sequence
examples: The fourteenth amendment guarantees equal protection under law
Her fourteenth birthday party was a memorable event

definitions: position number four in a sequence or series
one of four equal parts into which something is divided
examples: She finished fourth in the marathon race
The fourth grade students are studying multiplication
He ate a fourth of the pizza by himself
The company's fourth quarter results exceeded expectations

definitions: domestic bird kept for eggs or meat such as chicken or duck
wild bird hunted for food or sport
examples: The farmer raises various fowl including chickens and geese
Domestic fowl provide both meat and eggs
Hunters pursued waterfowl during the migration season
Wild fowl are protected during their breeding season

definitions: person who hunts or traps wild birds for food or sport
examples: The fowler set his nets before dawn
Medieval fowlers supplied birds to noble households

definitions: small wild animal with reddish fur and bushy tail
person who is clever, cunning, or sly in behavior
examples: A red fox crossed the forest path at dusk
The fox hunts for small rodents and birds
He was known as an old fox in business negotiations
Don't trust her completely, she's a real fox

definitions: spike-shaped seed head of certain grasses that can harm animals
bushy tail of a fox
examples: Foxtails can get stuck in dogs' ears and paws
The field was full of dangerous foxtail grasses
The fox's foxtail was thick and luxurious
Hunters prized the foxtail as a trophy

definitions: ballroom dance in 4/4 time with slow and quick steps
examples: They learned the foxtrot for their wedding reception
The band played a smooth foxtrot for the dancers

definitions: entrance hall or lobby in a house, hotel, or theater
examples: Guests gathered in the foyer before the performance
The marble foyer created an impressive first impression

definitions: process of injecting liquid at high pressure into rocks to extract oil or gas
examples: Environmental groups oppose fracking due to pollution concerns
The company uses fracking to extract natural gas from shale

definitions: complex geometric pattern that looks similar at every scale and repeats infinitely
examples: Computer programs can generate beautiful fractal images
Fractals appear in nature, like in snowflakes and coastlines

definitions: process of separating a mixture into different parts based on physical or chemical properties
examples: Oil refineries use fractionation to separate crude oil into useful products
The lab performed fractionation to isolate specific proteins

definitions: break or crack in a bone caused by injury or stress
crack, split, or break in any hard material or surface
examples: The X-ray showed a fracture in her wrist
He suffered multiple fractures in the car accident
The earthquake caused fractures in the building's foundation
Stress fractures appeared in the metal after repeated use

definitions: quality of being easily broken, damaged, or destroyed physically or emotionally
examples: The fragility of the crystal glasses required careful handling
The economic fragility became apparent during the crisis

definitions: small piece or part broken off or separated from something
examples: Archaeologists found pottery fragments at the dig site
Only fragments of the ancient manuscript survived

definitions: process of breaking something into small pieces or the state of being broken up
examples: Habitat fragmentation threatens many wildlife species
The fragmentation of the hard drive slowed computer performance

definitions: sweet or pleasant smell, especially from flowers or perfume
examples: The fragrance of roses filled the garden
She wore a light fragrance that smelled like vanilla

definitions: condition of being weak and delicate in body or health
examples: The nurse was concerned about the patient's increasing frailty
Human frailty becomes more apparent with advanced age

definitions: process of constructing a building's structural skeleton
way of presenting or understanding an issue or situation
examples: The framing of the house was completed in two weeks
Carpenters worked on framing the new addition
The media's framing of the story influenced public opinion
Her framing of the problem helped find a solution

definitions: former basic monetary unit of France, Belgium, and several other countries
examples: The price was listed in francs before the euro
She exchanged her francs for dollars at the bank

definitions: official mark or signature on mail indicating postage has been paid
examples: The letter bore an official frank from the senator's office
Government mail often carries a frank instead of stamps

definitions: seasoned smoked sausage made of beef and pork, commonly called a hot dog
examples: He ordered a frankfurter with mustard at the ballgame
The deli serves authentic German frankfurters

definitions: aromatic resin from trees used in incense and perfumes, especially in religious ceremonies
examples: The church burned frankincense during the Christmas service
Frankincense was one of the gifts brought to baby Jesus

definitions: informal term for fraternity, a social organization of male college students
examples: He joined a frat during his sophomore year
The frat house hosted parties every weekend
